tool.name: Clonotype Diversity Analysis
tool.description: Calculate unique clonotypes, Shannon Entropy, and Clonality for samples.

param.name: clone_input
param.label: MiXCR Clone File
param.help: Normalized Clonotype File. If specifying the frequency divisions argument, this file must have a column which specifies those divisions! The standard normalized clonotype file does not have these columns; they are added by the Group Clones tool.

param.name: old
param.label: Old column names?
param.help: Only check if using an older version of MiXCR.

param.name: div
param.label: Clone Divisions - Top Set or Freq Group
param.help: Comma-separated list of either integers (Top Set) or frequency divisions (Freq Group) with no spaces. Determines which subsets of the clonotype repertoire will be analyzed. If blank, entire repertoire will be analyzed. Top Set example: 10,25,50 will analyze the top10, top25, and top50 clones from the repertoire. Freq Group example: Small,Medium,Large will analyze clones in the small, medium, and large frequency groups (each separately). If the Freq Group option is used, the standard normalized clone files cannot be used. The files must first be processed by the Group Clones tool so that a column named 'Div' that contains the frequency group divisions is present.

tool.help: This tool calculates a variety of analysis metrics for each sample.
